description: Join Eastside Community Heritage (charity developing local community history & archives) in the Olympic Park for their exhibition launch and guided walk, remembering the spectacular Olympic and Paralympic Opening Ceremonies 10 years on.

factsheet.heading: The event
paragraphs: Meet at The View Tube cafe in Stratford to see Eastside Community Heritage's brand new exhibition, put together from interviews with local people who volunteered in the ceremonies.
Enjoy refreshments whilst you hear about the audition and rehearsal processes, the excitement of show night, and the legacy the 2012 Games have had on us all.

Afterwards, enjoy a free guided tour around the Olympic Park, where you will learn about its fascinating history. The walk will start from The View Tube cafe at 4pm and will last around 40-45 minutes.

We look forward to seeing you there! Click on the link to book your free place: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/remembering-the-2012-olympic-opening-ceremonies-exhibition-launch-and-walk-tickets-404013133157
This walk is offered free to the public as part of London Unseen, thanks to the Mayor of London's Commission for Diversity in the Public Realm.

location.address: The View Tube, Marshgate Lane, E15 2PJ

name: Remembering the 2012 Olympic Opening Ceremonies exhibition launch and walk
